text: How to get Deal paid via Stripe???  I'm not sure if I'm just dumb or HubSpot is not just well documented for developers.  I'm really confused.  Hope you can help.

<@U8THBCFC4> Thanks for clarifying. It _did_ look a little...rough on the edges, but I assumed that it was just an issue related to last week's outage :smile: Anyways, I would be stoked to get an an early access spot as well! Also, let me know if you guys need any feedback/input/real life use cases. A "theme options UI" is a feature we are missing dearly on an everyday basis on our website projects and GDD retainers :slightly_smiling_face:
Has anyone ever copied blog posts from one portal to another? I want to populate a developer portal to try some things out.
this was discussed last week i think
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C960Q64G4/p1553702063207800>
<@UBT0AHWLD> that’s perfect, thank you!
np, all i did was the allmighty "copy and paste" trick :wink:...
is there any article/knowledge base on how to setup lazy loading for dynamic pages in HubSpot?
like are you meaning you want the page to pull in data from the sub pages ajaxxy?
I think he means lazy loading for content not in the above the fold :smile:
right but I mean lazy loading the content, you’d do like you would any other page.
does anyone else here have whitescreens while loading the design manager?
do you have the developer chrome extension installed? Can you open the developer tools console in the design manager?
shouldn’t be seeing any issues we were pretty thorough in testing but just want to be sure
yes i have it installed
k please check chrome dev tools for javascript errors, let me know if you see one
Failed to load resource: net::ERR_BLOCKED_BY_CLIENT
for nr-spa-1118.js
:sweat_smile:  looks like HubSpot’s goof not ours then
Do you have an adblocker enabled for the page that could be potentially blocking that script?
i have an adblocker enabled i will disable it
good that cleared the error
:raised_hands:
thanks all for your help
<@U7SL518D6>  btw. in regards to creativity that sprocket april fools has to be one of the best jokes i have seen in a couple of weeks, well done!
i meant years lol
Thank you, we had fun making it
<@U4W2EG8RY> I would LOVE to hear some real life use cases! DMing you.
Also, <@U7ADCU3BM> DMing you as well!

Anyone have a recommendation for a single form that needs a dynamic value set depending on the page? like a demo form with a Product field that's hidden that shows dynamic info based on a link they selected
You could add that in the url as a query and it will autofill based on page you are on
?valuename=valuefortheinput
otherwise you could do it with javascript/jquery
rad. thank you <@U25C65C3S>!
(just make sure the field is hidden and on the form)

Hello everyone, I need help! Does anyone know how to style an email template? I am trying to style a blog list email, it's grabbing the posts from the blog posts section on HubSpot and putting them in a page... it is using the default template (Main Email Body), that basically creates tables for everything (for email support) but I can't find a way to style this page or how the posts are displayed... Can someone help me please?

FYI, as many of you know that HubSpot had an incident on last Thursday <https://status.HubSpot.com/incidents/df5scsqc2f6p>. We have disabled CSS combining since to avoid causing more issues. We will re-enable it later.
indeed i see the  “still problems” notification in my portal
so this can be related to the incident from last week?
Could be. I am not sure what is you particular issue.

Ran into a pretty obnoxious bug caused by publishing from content staging.

If a page you are linking to is in content staging, and gets published, the link is still tied to the old page, thus it links to the archived page instead of the page getting published.
We just launched a website redesign and basically we now have to go through every page on the site since we used the link fields
Yea it's horrible, always happens to me with menus

yea that’s what happened to us, also happened with link fields in modules. It really needs addressing badly.

The site we just launched a redesign for has thousands of pages. it’s really difficult to get em all
agreed, I tend to end up scanning the site with insite to pick up any missed links
Bug: The JS HS injects for managing comments in blog posts is throwing errors in IE 11. IE 11 is officially supported by HS
